snippet: Campaign aides are mapping out adjustments toward a moderate approach that runs the risk of reopening a debate about the candidate’s authenticity.
abstract: Mitt Romney will seek to capitalize on moderate persona he presented at the first presidential debate, which was received with enthusiasm by independent voters; shift exposes Romney to accusations of inconsistency, given the fiercely conservative tone he struck earlier in the campaign.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Jeff Zeleny contributed from reporting from Sidney, Ohio.

lead_paragraph: Campaign aides are mapping out adjustments toward a moderate approach that runs the risk of reopening a debate about the candidate’s authenticity.

headline.main: Romney Campaign Looks to Capitalize on Image Voters Saw in Debate
headline.print_headline: Romney Campaign Looks to Capitalize on Image Voters Saw in Debate
